item.title: EIU has identified six areas of growth in Asia
item.description:
A new study by the Economist Intelligence Unit (EIU) highlights six industry sectors poised for significant growth in Asia: engineering services, environmental technology, food processing, healthcare, oil & gas, and wholesale & retail. Commissioned by InvestKL, Kuala Lumpur’s investment agency, the “industry dynamism” barometer suggests sustained corporate investment in Asia will drive long-term economic expansion. Engineering Services Asia’s need for new infrastructure is fueling rapid growth in engineering services. An estimated US$8 to US$9 trillion will be invested in infrastructure between 2010 and 2020...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/eiu-has-identified-six-areas-of-growth-in-asia/

item.title: The first GYOMU and Megumi-no-Sato stores have opened in Singapore
item.description:
Source: G-7 Holdings. Pictures of GYOMU Supermarket and Megumi-no-Sato. G7 International, a subsidiary of the Kobe-based G-7 Holdings responsible for international operations, has launched a GYOMU supermarket and the first overseas Megumi-no-Sato store in Singapore. Both stores will be managed by BB&G-7 Retail, a joint venture between G7 International and a local Singaporean company. GYOMU Japan is a wholesale franchise chain known for offering imported products under its own private label at competitive prices...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-first-gyomu-and-megumi-no-sato-stores-have-opened-in-singapore/
